TypeSignature.Value: public abstract class Uri : Java.Lang.Object, Android.OS.IParcelable, IDisposable, Java.Lang.IComparable

.class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit Uri extends Java.Lang.Object implements class Android.OS.IParcelable, class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.Lang.IComparable, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: Immutable URI reference.

remarks.para: Immutable URI reference. A URI reference includes a URI and a fragment, the component of the URI following a '#'. Builds and parses URI references which conform to .

In the interest of performance, this class performs little to no validation. Behavior is undefined for invalid input. This class is very forgiving--in the face of invalid input, it will return garbage rather than throw an exception unless otherwise specified.

remarks.para: This constructor is invoked by the runtime infrastructure () to create a new managed representation for a Java Native Interface object.
The constructor will initializes the property of the new instance using and .

Docs.summary: Gets the decoded authority part of this URI.

remarks.para: Gets the decoded authority part of this URI. For server addresses, the authority is structured as follows: [ userinfo '@' ] host [ ':' port ]
Examples: "google.com", "bob@google.com:80"

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig string Decode(string s) cil managed

Docs.summary: Decodes '%'-escaped octets in the given string using the UTF-8 scheme.

remarks.para: Decodes '%'-escaped octets in the given string using the UTF-8 scheme. Replaces invalid octets with the unicode replacement character ("\\uFFFD").

The empty URI, equivalent to "".

remarks.para: The empty URI, equivalent to "".

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig string Encode(string s) cil managed

Docs.summary: Encodes characters in the given string as '%'-escaped octets using the UTF-8 scheme.

remarks.para: Encodes characters in the given string as '%'-escaped octets using the UTF-8 scheme. Leaves letters ("A-Z", "a-z"), numbers ("0-9"), and unreserved characters ("_-!.~'()*") intact. Encodes all other characters.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string Encode (string s, string allow);
.method public static hidebysig string Encode(string s, string allow) cil managed

Docs.param: set of additional characters to allow in the encoded form, null if no characters should be skipped
Docs.summary: Encodes characters in the given string as '%'-escaped octets using the UTF-8 scheme.

remarks.para: Encodes characters in the given string as '%'-escaped octets using the UTF-8 scheme. Leaves letters ("A-Z", "a-z"), numbers ("0-9"), and unreserved characters ("_-!.~'()*") intact. Encodes all other characters with the exception of those specified in the allow argument.

Docs.summary: Gets the encoded authority part of this URI.

remarks.para: Gets the encoded authority part of this URI. For server addresses, the authority is structured as follows: [ userinfo '@' ] host [ ':' port ]
Examples: "google.com", "bob@google.com:80"

Docs.summary: Gets the encoded fragment part of this URI, everything after the '#'.

remarks.para: Gets the encoded fragment part of this URI, everything after the '#'.

Docs.summary: Gets the encoded path.

remarks.para: Gets the encoded path.

Docs.summary: Gets the encoded query component from this URI.

remarks.para: Gets the encoded query component from this URI. The query comes after the query separator ('?') and before the fragment separator ('#'). This method would return "q=android" for "http://www.google.com/search?q=android".

Docs.summary: Gets the scheme-specific part of this URI, i.e. everything between the scheme separator ':' and the fragment separator '#'.

remarks.para: Gets the scheme-specific part of this URI, i.e. everything between the scheme separator ':' and the fragment separator '#'. If this is a relative URI, this method returns the entire URI. Leaves escaped octets intact.
Example: "//www.google.com/search?q=android"

Docs.summary: Gets the encoded user information from the authority.

remarks.para: Gets the encoded user information from the authority. For example, if the authority is "nobody@google.com", this method will return "nobody".

Docs.summary: Gets the decoded fragment part of this URI, everything after the '#'.

remarks.para: Gets the decoded fragment part of this URI, everything after the '#'.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class Android.Net.Uri FromFile(class Java.IO.File file) cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a Uri from a file.

remarks.para: Creates a Uri from a file. The URI has the form "file://". Encodes path characters with the exception of '/'.
Example: "file:///tmp/android.txt"

MemberSignature.Value: public static Android.Net.Uri FromParts (string scheme, string ssp, string fragment);
.method public static hidebysig class Android.Net.Uri FromParts(string scheme, string ssp, string fragment) cil managed

Docs.param: scheme-specific-part, everything between the scheme separator (':') and the fragment separator ('#'), which will get encoded
fragment, everything after the '#', null if undefined, will get encoded
Docs.summary: Creates an opaque Uri from the given components.

remarks.para: Creates an opaque Uri from the given components. Encodes the ssp which means this method cannot be used to create hierarchical URIs.

Docs.exception: if scheme or ssp is null

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool GetBooleanQueryParameter (string key, bool defaultValue);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool GetBooleanQueryParameter(string key, bool defaultValue) cil managed

Docs.param: the default value to return if there is no query parameter for key
Docs.summary: Searches the query string for the first value with the given key and interprets it as a boolean value. "false" and "0" are interpreted as false, everything else is interpreted as true.

remarks.para: Searches the query string for the first value with the given key and interprets it as a boolean value. "false" and "0" are interpreted as false, everything else is interpreted as true.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetQueryParameter(string key) cil managed

Docs.summary: Searches the query string for the first value with the given key.

remarks.para: Searches the query string for the first value with the given key.
Warning: Prior to Jelly Bean, this decoded the '+' character as '+' rather than ' '.

Docs.exception: if this isn't a hierarchical URI

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<string> GetQueryParameters(string key) cil managed

Docs.summary: Searches the query string for parameter values with the given key.

remarks.para: Searches the query string for parameter values with the given key.

Docs.exception: if this isn't a hierarchical URI

Docs.summary: Gets the encoded host from the authority for this URI.

remarks.para: Gets the encoded host from the authority for this URI. For example, if the authority is "bob@google.com", this method will return "google.com".

Docs.summary: Returns true if this URI is absolute, i.e. if it contains an explicit scheme.

remarks.para: Returns true if this URI is absolute, i.e. if it contains an explicit scheme.

Docs.summary: Returns true if this URI is hierarchical like "http://google.com".

remarks.para: Returns true if this URI is hierarchical like "http://google.com". Absolute URIs are hierarchical if the scheme-specific part starts with a '/'. Relative URIs are always hierarchical.

Docs.summary: Returns true if this URI is opaque like "mailto:nobody@google.com".

remarks.para: Returns true if this URI is opaque like "mailto:nobody@google.com". The scheme-specific part of an opaque URI cannot start with a '/'.

Docs.summary: Returns true if this URI is relative, i.e. if it doesn't contain an explicit scheme.

remarks.para: Returns true if this URI is relative, i.e. if it doesn't contain an explicit scheme.

Docs.summary: To be added.
Gets the decoded last segment in the path.

remarks.para: Gets the decoded last segment in the path.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Net.Uri NormalizeScheme() cil managed

Docs.summary: Return an equivalent URI with a lowercase scheme component.

remarks.para: Return an equivalent URI with a lowercase scheme component. This aligns the Uri with Android best practices for intent filtering.
For example, "HTTP://www.android.com" becomes "http://www.android.com"
All URIs received from outside Android (such as user input, or external sources like Bluetooth, NFC, or the Internet) should be normalized before they are used to create an Intent.

This method does not validate bad URI's, or 'fix' poorly formatted URI's - so do not use it for input validation. A Uri will always be returned, even if the Uri is badly formatted to begin with and a scheme component cannot be found.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class Android.Net.Uri Parse(string uriString) cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a Uri which parses the given encoded URI string.

remarks.para: Creates a Uri which parses the given encoded URI string.

Docs.summary: Gets the decoded path.

remarks.para: Gets the decoded path.

Docs.summary: Gets the decoded path segments.

remarks.para: Gets the decoded path segments.

Docs.summary: Gets the port from the authority for this URI.

remarks.para: Gets the port from the authority for this URI. For example, if the authority is "google.com:80", this method will return 80.

Docs.summary: Gets the decoded query component from this URI.

remarks.para: Gets the decoded query component from this URI. The query comes after the query separator ('?') and before the fragment separator ('#'). This method would return "q=android" for "http://www.google.com/search?q=android".

Docs.summary: Returns a set of the unique names of all query parameters.

remarks.para: Returns a set of the unique names of all query parameters. Iterating over the set will return the names in order of their first occurrence.

Docs.exception: if this isn't a hierarchical URI

Docs.summary: Gets the scheme of this URI.

remarks.para: Gets the scheme of this URI. Example: "http"

Docs.summary: Gets the scheme-specific part of this URI, i.e. everything between the scheme separator ':' and the fragment separator '#'.

remarks.para: Gets the scheme-specific part of this URI, i.e. everything between the scheme separator ':' and the fragment separator '#'. If this is a relative URI, this method returns the entire URI. Decodes escaped octets.
Example: "//www.google.com/search?q=android"

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.

Docs.summary: Gets the decoded user information from the authority.

remarks.para: Gets the decoded user information from the authority. For example, if the authority is "nobody@google.com", this method will return "nobody".
